Reviews.Title: “Oh so spotless and immaculate!”
Reviews.Author: wineandcheesedayz
Reviews.Content: I was met by friendly and efficient reception staff and was allocated a very spacious room with king bed and a small, but functional kitchen. I had a corner room, so not sure if all the rooms were as big as the one I had. Was impressed that together with the microwave, there was a sandwich press. The hotel is perfectly positioned for easy access to Oxford St Darlinghurst, and just a short walk to Central station. Tastefully decorated, there were also nice touches such as chocolates on the pillow. Felt I could have eaten from the floor or bench surfaces. Huge television, and together with Foxtel, there is a dvd player. The double glazing ensured a good nights sleep, even though I was on the first floor. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in central location but staff not friendly”
Reviews.Author: Amandatravels7
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very spacious and beds comfortable. Location is ideal for exploring Sydney. Shower was large and had good water pressure. The one downfall was the unfriendliness of most of the front desk staff. One guy in particular was very snotty. But this didn't ruin our stay and the other benefits of the hotel outweigh the staff. Very convenient and delicious cafe downstairs for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: palls19
Reviews.Content: we had a nice, clean room, had a late check-in but was smooth, got top floor. bathroom great, nice bed, good tv channels. oh and not to forget, great location, stayed 2 nights. downsides- breakfast for 14.95 is appalling!! it was a public holiday so we were kinda forced to eat there. but pls dont eat there. lift is very small! the main doors close at like 700pm! the guy during our check in was much nicer than the guy during check -out. he refused to call us a cab, ( had a flight out so it was urgent), said -"plenty outside, just hail", we had to wait 5 mins before we actually saw one to hail! it was a public holiday weekend. people were making so much noise on the floor outside, felt like they were in our room.paper thin walls!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: B_in_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Plus Stellar for two nights in April. The studio apartment was spacious and well appointed. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location is very good, near the Museum station and close to Chinatown, Darling Harbour, Hyde Park, and Central Station. However, given its location, there isn't much natural light that comes into the room. Then again, one isn't in Sydney to stay in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for us”
Reviews.Author: Heather B
Reviews.Content: We were attending an event at Sydney Entertainment Centre and stayed at Hotel Stellar for 6 nights in March. The location was perfect: we walked everywhere the whole week. The 'executive suite' we had was fresh and new, fabulous bathrooms and comfortable beds. There is a cafe attached to the hotel lobby for great morning coffees. The suite was clean and comfortable, the staff were friendly, we had no problems. The room was not cheap, but totally worth it for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great room!”
Reviews.Author: ymphz
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my husband and was very impressed with the room. furniture and bathroom fixtures are new and modern! downside are the thin walls and floors. we can hear people walking about on the room right above us. we can hear closing doors from outside and people talking while waiting for the lift. they might want to install soundproof rooms but for the price we paid, we are still satisfied. oh also, parking is really tight but staff are great and very helpful! would come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Shlomi74
Reviews.Content: Actually it's an apartments hotel. the apartment i stayed in was very big.super clean, everything was new and shiny.LCD TV, a Kitchen equipped with Microwave,kettle,and dishes etc.minibar,air conditioning and free Wifi/cable connection.frankly,the apartment is on a very high level, it could be easily defined as a luxury one,so in that meaning it's even better than an Hotel.The location is very central, just 5-7 walking from George St. 1 min walking from Oxford St.also it's very close to the Subway Station as well so it's very convenient.the big plus in choosing this hotel that its prices are cheaper than many hotels in Sydney CBD.Sydney unfortunately is very expensive for accommodation as l learned,so choosing this Hotel was really a good Choice.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: ducky2010
Reviews.Content: Sheets and towels are clean, bed is comfortable, location is convenient, kitchenette is handy. Nothing to complain about, nothing to get excited about. In this price range you can't do much better. That being said, if you can afford a little more to stay somewhere a little nicer, go for it. If on the other hand, this is your budget range, then Stellar is a safe bet.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: GYBB
Reviews.Content: Good location near shops and grocery store. Easy access to downtown and several bus stops nearby. A small cafe is inside the hotel which is open day and during the week only. The sound insulation is not adequate because they provides earplugs in the rooms. The staff is friendly but we still think we disturb them because they are always complete papers.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Duane S
Reviews.Content: This is a well located older hotel, near Hyde Park and a 30 minute walk to the Harbour. Our room was spacious and clean. Service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, spacious rooms and good location for the price”
Reviews.Author: Kate M
Reviews.Content: We were pleased to find an affordable hotel within walking distance of the main Sydney attractions, and were pleasantly surprised to arrive and see that the hotel had everything we needed (plus a lot more space!). The washing-up is a bit tedious though, and we found that grocery shopping is very expensive here (about $30 for some milk, bread, a box of cereal and a packet of cereal bars), so after the first day we opted to eat out rather than use the kitchenette. Groceries might be cheaper if you shop further away from tourist areas, but we spoke to several locals who agreed that grocery shopping was very expensive in Sydney. So if you're picking this hotel becuase you plan to self-cater, make sure you budget wisely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fair price”
Reviews.Author: Alan_490416
Reviews.Content: The Stellar is just on the corner of Hyde Park so you get a nice stroll through the park on your way to the harbour, Opera House etc. It's also pretty well next door to a good sized supermarket - useful as the room has a microwave and toaster plus small dining table and chairs. There's a good bed, large TV and excellent shower. Service is OK but not particularly friendly. We wouldn't hesitate to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, Comfortable and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTripper68
Reviews.Content: Stayed just two nights in Jan 2012 at the Stellar and were pleasantly surprised. Clean, comfortable and a nice location for us - next to Hyde park and Oxford street and very close to train and bus stops which we used. We had a nice walk to circular quay for a trip on the ferry to Tooronga park zoo and caught the free sydney circle bus back to the hotel at the end of the day. It's a small hotel didn't seem to offer all fancy extra's of really big hotels, but we weren't looking for that - just an economoical, comfortable, relaxed central location to explore Syndney from. staff were always very helpful - only one minor annoyance was the electric sliding entry doors were not working well - meaning you had to wait on occassion for staff to notice you and open the doors from inside...hope they have it fixed by now!

Reviews.Title: “A little deceiving from the outside, however, rooms are very nice.”
Reviews.Author: ILoveNYAustralia
Reviews.Content: Our room was one on the main road, so it was a bit noisy when the traffic started in the early hours, but very nice room. It was a pleasant surprise really.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Rose G
Reviews.Content: Moved here from some previously booked accomodation which was unsatisfactory. The room was clean and well presented with a kitchenette which was well equipped for light meals and snacks. The double glazed windows kept outside noise to a minimum and we slept very well in this busy part of town. The bed was comfortable and there was a flat screen TV with some foxtel channels. The staff were friendly and helpful. Only one lift which broke down while we were there. Fortunately we were not on the 6th floor! The problem was rectified as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stays, but noisy at night.”
Reviews.Author: AKtreker
Reviews.Content: We only needed a hotel for one night in Sydney, and the Best Western Plus Hotel Stellar was fine. However, I would not like to stay there for more than a couple nights, because it is located in a very busy and noisy part of Sydney, especially at night. The one night we stayed, a Friday night, there were noisy happy drunks yelling and screaming way into the early morning hours, and a couple police sirens going off, so it was very difficult to sleep. The room itself was fine, with a great little kitchenette set-up; toaster, microwave, small refrigerator, dishes, electric kettle, so you could warm up food and/or make a light breakfast. The beds were ok, except for the extra sofa bed, which had a very thin mattress and was sagging in the middle and tilting to the right. This is a three star hotel at best. The location is good for seeing the sights, but like I said before, it is very busy and noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: MincePye
Reviews.Content: We had booked this room with the promise of a "kitchenette", which more often than not means an electric kettle and a bar fridge, so we were delighted to find a spacious room offering jug, microwave, toaster/sandwich press, refrigerator and a great selection of crockery & cutlery. We we able to make our own breakfast every day rather than pay for an expensive hotel breakfast. (World Square Mall supermarket is only 3-4 blocks away and although not huge offers plenty of breakfast supply options). Location is great, minutes to trains (we flew into international airport, took the express train to city and only had to walk 300 metres) and close (but not too close) to Hyde Park so pretty quiet at night (windows had triple glazing). Bed was comfortable, shower was huge, lots of restaurant options nearby on Oxford St, overall very happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Pricey Sydney”
Reviews.Author: BreezinDelta
Reviews.Content: Great location near bus line/train line from airport...near Hyde Park, Botanic Gardens, Australian Museum etc. Kitchen was very handy to use for breakfasts & even take out one night. Staff was helpful & friendly...room clean & functional.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star???”
Reviews.Author: TeHaumi
Reviews.Content: How can a hotel with no swimming pool, and no fitness centre, and only one lift have 4 stars? The Hotel Stellar is very close to Hyde Park, Museum Railway Station, and the inner city. But its rooms should be called small bedrooms with a kitchenette, and 3 small chairs, rather than Studio Apartments. If you wish to have 2 Twin Single Beds, rather than 1 Queen Bed you should contact the hotel directly before arrival if you do not want to end up with an unwanted bedding configuration.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay without the huge price tag”
Reviews.Author: alwysluv2travel
Reviews.Content: Easy to find from the train station. Stayed in room 604 which was top floor and spacious. Had king bed and rollaway. Breakfast was sufficient to get started. Close to darling harbour and about 15-20 mins to circular quay. Free bus not far from hotel. Staff were great and only mini service of room each day which was okay. Would stay again for a few days. If you want more trimmings pay more and stay closer to circular quay. However for a good deal this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Jag1988
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with the BW rewards. Hotel is small but is in a good location just across from Hyde Park and on the route of the Hop-on-hop-off bus. Walking distance to Chinatown and pretty much everything. Room was clean but the housekeeping staff didn't provide us with fresh bottles of shampoo and lotion. Since it was only one-night stay, it was enough for us so we didn't complain. The hotel has a lot of funny noises. Our room was right next to the housekeeping laundry room so it was noisy when we checked-in but they shut it down in the late afternoon. But we still heard some intermittent noises from upstairs. When we reported the noise to the front desk, the staff asked us to turn the TV on to cover up the noise and use the ear plugs provided in the room. What a joke! Overall, it was a reasonable stay but we will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: wannago58
Reviews.Content: Booked from Wotif - on arrival male at desk rather uninteresting and no personality - seemed to think being a hotel receptionist was above us. Room very nice and clean - wifi is $5 an hour. Very very noisy but I suppose should be expected. Air conditioning I really think was not working room was very stuffy. overall all OK apart from uninteresting late 20's male at desk which is always your window i nto the hotel. He directed me down to the car park not a smile or hint of personality or conversation!!!! BORING and UNWELCOMINGl

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: EE78
Reviews.Content: Facilities were good. Location wise was great. Just a walking distance to Hyde Park. Located at a quiet, non-busy street, which is good for us. There's a 7-eleven few shops down, which was a major plus if you are looking for smth at the wee hours. Staff are friendly & accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Value hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: bylife
Reviews.Content: a good hotel for comfortable, it's value with its service. Staff are nice. But poor wireless connection. It not type of hotel for buniess trip and Iron was poor condition to work. Moreover, room was clean except there was a piece of lady hair on the pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean rooms - enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ashes856
Reviews.Content: We booked quite last minute but still got fantastic rates (aprox $190 AUD per night for 3 people including breakfast). Our 3 night stay turned into 4 when Qantas left us stranded but staff were very accommodating allowing us to extend our stay for another night in the same room with one days notice (aprox $170 AUD for the extra night). Room was spotless, modern and thoroughly cleaned daily. We were on the first level overlooking the road so some traffic noise was expected but the double glazed windows ensured it was minimal. The bathroom and shower were very spacious and well supplied. The small kitchen was perfect for our needs. The sofa bed was extremely comfortable and the chocolates on arrival were a nice touch. Unfortunately the TV seemed to have some reception issues but with all the attractions nearby this was hardly a problem. Staff were very helpful and polite, a big thankyou to the staff member who provided calm assistance in getting us transport to the hospital at 1am. Breakfast was nice enough for a continental breakfast. Location is wonderful, a very short walk to museum station and hyde park, if you're not keen on walking catch the free bus (number 555 - the green bus) from one st over - it will take you anywhere from circular quay to QVB or very close to China town.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean rooms - great for short business trips.”
Reviews.Author: chinwag
Reviews.Content: Stayed just for night on a trip for work. Location is great, very near Hyde Park and within walking distance to most of the CBD or at least to our offices :-) Rooms are simple but clean and functional.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great stay”
Reviews.Author: krissy1103
Reviews.Content: my husband and i were on a budget trip and this hotel was a pretty great deal. we were 1 block from the subway / bus station and about 4 blocks to the central station. we walked a block to the bus stop and went to bondi for sunrise (beautiful!). there was a grocery store next door so we were able to get some snacks and food. the lobby is very minimal but that's not why we were staying there (to enjoy the lobby). you can store your luggage if necesary. they had free water in the lobby, computers w/ internet and printing (came in handy when checking in/printing boarding passes). the kitchen was definitely a plus (standard microwave, plates, utensils). helped us save on breakfast. they were doing construction so we heard some loud noises at times but it was bearable.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: mci_11
Reviews.Content: Friendly service at check in, comfortable room with two comfortable queen beds. Location was great, we were on 6th floor and at the back so it was quiet overall. Nice complimentary gift awaiting. Walking distance to free shuttle and to monorail. Comfortable walk through Hyde Park to the city shops. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Family - Clean, Comfortable, Close to Sights”
Reviews.Author: 4foolsofwonder
Reviews.Content: This hotel turned out to be a gem! After travelling for 3 weeks throughout Australia and NZ, we were happy for this newly renovated, modern, comfortable, spacious hotel to be our last stop before heading home. The location was great - a 20 min walk to the Quay, Chinatown, Hyde Park or the Opera House. In the morning, we were able to catch the Free 555 bus into town and then walk back in the evening. The hotel staff was friendly but not very helpful with getting the bags to our room. The rooms were beautifully decorated with tall curtains and comfy beds. My only complaint was that our room, which was on the 2nd floor, faced a brick wall and alley - not much of a view. My husband wasn't bothered by it and reminded me that we would only be in the room to sleep as we had a busy itinerary for Sydney. I will say that facing the back did make the room very quiet. We purchased the continental breakfast package for the 4 of us. A quick, simple breakfast enabled us to get to the sights faster. Breakfast entailed juice, coffee, toast, cereal, cheese, meat, yogurt and fresh fruit. Not bad for a few extra dollars a night. I highly recommend this hotel for families, couples or singles. It was a nice surprise to find that the rooms actually looked nicer than in the website photos.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Jen W
Reviews.Content: my husband and I need travel to Sydney more than 10 times a year, so we've already tried almost all of the 5, 4.5 and 4 star hotel in Sydney if there was a great deal. Hotel Stellar is definitely an outstanding place to choose with great location, best value and comfortable room. the staff was very friendly and helpful, and the cleanliness of the room was Impeccable. you can find lots of small details show the careness from the hotel to guests, like chocolate on the pillow, variety types of tea bags (not just black tea, since its a 4 star hotel, i think its remarkable), ribbon in the shower cap box, ear plug (which is totally unnecessary) etc...we booked a stander room and got a room on 6th floor with 3 windows and 2 queen size beds and a huge ensuit. At first i thought the room bit noisy but soon found out they left the double glazed window slightly open, after shut the window you can barely heard any noise from the street. Did't try breakfast or room service so no commend on that. car parking is not exactly on site but only takes few steps to walk to. we'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cleanly rooms”
Reviews.Author: CAtraveller77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on two separate times during our two week trip to Australia. Upon arrival to Sydney it was only 8am in the morning, well before check in time, but they had a room available and allowed us to check in early, which was great after spending 17 hours traveling. The first room we had was spacious, clean, the bed was comfortable and the shower had great water pressure. When we returned to the hotel a week later for our second stay, we had a different room and it was also very clean and comfortable. The kitchenette doesn't have a stove, just a microwave, sink and fridge so you can only do limited food, but we were able to have breakfast in each day saving time and money. The ony downside is that the rooms don't have a lot of lighting- there aren't large ceiling lights and for the room to be well lit we'd have to turn on all the kitchenette lights, the bedside lights and open all the blinds. Kind of annoying, but not a deal breaker. We had 1st floor rooms both times so there was no view, but the location is great and we were able to walk everywhere we needed, including the harbor, restraurants, shopping, pubs, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice central location, has everything you need for short trips”
Reviews.Author: chinwag
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night on a work related trip to Sydney. The place is practically just across Hyde Park and is walking distance to the CBD and just about anything. It is clean and has everything you need. Facilities in the room were superb. The only possible downside is linked to its upside of being in a central location, the traffic noise can be noticeable as it is on a relatively busy intersection.

Reviews.Title: “Handy and helpful”
Reviews.Author: starmanChristchurch
Reviews.Content: Hotel Stellar is in a great location at the top of Hyde Park and easy walking distance to the CBD and Circular Quay. The nearby Museum station offers easy access to Sydney's excellent rail service. We had a great stay. The room was clean and well maintained. The staff were very helpful. We would happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “A surprise find!”
Reviews.Author: dmcbella
Reviews.Content: I booked this through last minute.com. The location of the Hotel is great, close to the city and very close to Oxford St. Upon arrival the room had been upgraded to a king size bed and once I actually viewed the room I was very surprised- it was spacious, clean and had a well sized bathroom. The room was facing the road but never found this to be a problem with noise or traffic. The room rate was very affordable and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Howde
Reviews.Content: The delux unit was on the top floor. it was spacious and had a couch for relaxing. The windows were double glazed and traffic noise was minimal. The kitchenette was functional and clean. The room service menu for evening meals was good value, and there are restaurants a few minutes walk away.The hotel is close to the museum train station stop for easy transport to and from the airport. We saw two shows and both were in easy walking distance. Great value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice and simple”
Reviews.Author: BellaOlive
Reviews.Content: THe staff were very friendly off the bat. When they saw I was travelling with my son they upgraded us without me asking. The rooms are modern and very clean. Not too much of a view but the windows open. The beds are really comforable. Great shower and nice little kitchenette. The lift is quite slow, that would be the only downside. There is a cute little cafe in the reception area that does ok coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: PKontheroad
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stella for a long weekend with a group of friends. The room was very spacious and clean and the staff were very helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel as an affordable option for those wanting to stay in and around the oxford st and Surrey Hills areas. The traffic noise was a little loud, but the hotel is kind enough to supply ear plugs in the draw next to the bed, which was very nice of them.

Reviews.Title: “great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: tessh01
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a long weekend, I felt the location couldnt have been better - right between the city and oxford st, so almost anywhere in the city area was walking distance (or a small cab/bus ride). The room was clean, modern and a decent size. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “TA didn't disappoint, this place is a gem”
Reviews.Author: Europeansummer2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in July 2011 after reading TA's reviews. The rooms are newly refurbished, everything is perfect. The room is quite spacious, you get a small dining table, work table and the bed. The bed was super comfy, kitchen fully equipped, bathroom very clean and bright, nice big tv... tastefully decorated. I would definitely stay here again. It's in easy walking distance to all the action and perfectly situated for a walk to the Botanic Gardens before breakfast. Lots of options for dinner along Oxford St which is on the corner.

Reviews.Title: “deserves good reviews”
Reviews.Author: numberoneson
Reviews.Content: this hotel is a good value and probably the best Best Western I have stayed at great location, large rooms with kitchen, relatively quiet with decent service

Reviews.Title: “a great find close to the action of Oxford St”
Reviews.Author: pandaboys
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Sydney to a attend a week long company workshop and wanted a hotel not too far from our Sydney office. Hotel Stellar was on my list of 'available' hotels and it's combination of great location, very nice room and pleasant staff means we'll look to stay here when we're paying for a visit to Sydney, not on the company tab. The corporate price I paid was a bargain. From the outside it doesn't look like much and the tiny enclosed reception desk gives no indication of the standard of the rooms. I believe I'm actually in a deluxe so my my review is based on this room but it is a perfect city base, with one exception - the tv. Our last Sydney hotel had a similar issue - wrong aspect being broadcast to the rooms. Television has been broadcast in Australia in widescreen for many years now. When will hotels stop treating their customers like chumps and provide in room tvs with the correct aspect. I'm watching Sky news at the moment and the reporters are all short and fat and half of the information on the screen is off the edges. Can it really be that hard? Back to the room though. Looks like it was renovated last week. Very modern. Comfy bed, kitchenette with microwave, jug, toaster, fridge etc. Sofa, lots of cupboard space, big bathroom with decent products. Decent priced minibar. Silly chair at the desk though. It needs to be higher or the desk lower. The hotel offers a buffet continental breakfast in the 'underground' bar or you can get a cooked brekkie in the cafe that leads off the hotel lobby. Oddly you can't charge back from there. They also offer room service for dinner/late night (that I didn't try) and the bar in the lobby (staffed by the hotel receptionist as required) offers a two for one happy hour each evening from 5pm to 6pm. Nice! All in all I would highly recommend the Stellar as a well located base for a Sydney stay, especially if you intend to hit the bars of Oxford Street. apologies for the fairly ordinary photos :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Hugill
Reviews.Content: As this was our first time to Sydney we wanted a hotel that was central and walking distance to most attractions and we found it! It was only about a half hour walk to the harbour. Our unit had a kitchen which was great and there was an IGA around the corner. The room was very clean and the staff were helpful. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Can't say I would rush back.”
Reviews.Author: traveller567Hongkong
Reviews.Content: I spent a long time trying to find a good hotel for us in Sydney which was within our budget, in a decent location and suitable for a young family. On the whole hotel stellar did this. We arrived at 10 am and our room was ready (just good luck I guess). the room was very dull. No colour or life in it. It was, however, generally clean but not spotless. the bed was comfy and the bathroom was ok. We really didn't use the kitchenette and don't think we would chose to stay somewhere with one again. The staff were polite. Breakfast was very basic and limited but the service friendly. The location was pretty good as it is near the park and close to transport. the hotel is walking distance to central station and darling Harbour. however there was very few decent places to eat near by. Although I can recommend Alexanders on the Park for lunch. Over all I am not disappointed with my choice but would try somewhere different next. time.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for city visit”
Reviews.Author: Jerry59
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights before heading back to the UK at the end of a three week trip in Australia. This hotel is in an ideal location being on the edge of the business district and city, so being close enough but not too close to get the noise. Our room was adequate with a kitchen area and good sized ensuite. Parking was available but very limited and charged. Wifi internet was available and although charged it was not necessary to use the credit all in one session. You could take up to 14 days to use it up. This was the only place during our trip that this was offered with the other internet credits having to be used in a single session. There was also a cafe and bar attached. In relation to the location it was approx 20 mins walk to Darling Harbour and 35 mins to Circular Quay (Opera House and bridge). There were frequent buses which ran from around the corner of the hotel to all parts of the city. It was very easy to get to the airport with a train station within five minutes walk of the hotel and the fare was $15.80. That took you right to both the domestic and international airports in about 25 mins. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room - wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: jazbluemodi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Stellar was at the top end of our budget, and a little treat whilst staying in Sydney for three nights. We stayed in a Queen Suite on the fourth floor which had loads of room, a kitchenette (complete with table/chairs, microwave, kettle, toaster, sink, coffee perculator and cutlery/crockery). Room comes with large flatscreen TV and all working channels. The bathroom was spacious and very clean. Staff were always helpful and friendly, and fixed a lightbulb in our room when it went out immediately upon request. Beware of the minibar! - it's tempting (and they top it up daily). Annoyingly it takes up quite a large amount of the fridge space so if you want to store your own food/beer you have to keep it minimal but there's enough room for perishables if you're staying for just a few nights only. The hotel was amazingly quiet considering it's central location (15 mins walk from Sydney Central Station) and there are good restaurants/cafes/bars very close.

Reviews.Title: “A most pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: jictor
Reviews.Content: For what we paid, we were surprised to find such clean, spacious rooms with stylist decor and comfortable beds. Even the sofabed was as comfortable as the single bed, and the mini kitchen had a microwave and dishes. The location was ok, a bit away from the hot spots which meant a little bit of walking but also meant nice quiet nights. The only downsides were that the hotel didn't have a gym or pool, the windows could not be opened more than a few inches, the air-con temperature could not be adjusted, and the pillows were too fluffy for my taste. The service was great. One night we met an obviously drunk flasher in the doorway and the valiant reception guy got rid of him quickly and with minimum fuss. When we needed a taxi in the rain another reception guy got out there and got one for us quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: rosietas
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a budget hotel that is clean and roomy in a handy location this is the one to consider. The staff were very polite and helpful, the room was spacious and clean and the price was good. Close to Hyde Park and lots of restaraunts close by. Its a good clean no frills hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice”
Reviews.Author: McGalio
Reviews.Content: We cheap out in Sydney when we go, and we found this because it was close to the Travelodge making it easy to find.) The price we got was good. When we showed up I thought it might be a dive. The reception area and the hallways were not great. But, the room itself was fantastic. Lots of room, a kitchen area, a friggin' awesome shower. The bed was big and comfy, the TV was huge. They even left a mint on our pillow. It's a cliche, but I don't think I've ever had it happen before. Very comfortable stay. Walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Arandale
Reviews.Content: A good-sized room, kithenette and bathroom, with the hotel close to 'Museum' metro stop. Limited selection of hot & cold food for breakfast. Internet access fast but there is a charge, including $0.50 per sheet for printing.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights in Sydney after a long road trip and before the long flight home”
Reviews.Author: Donkey37
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our trip to Aus. Hotel location was good, could easily walk to all major attractions.....bit dark and lonely at night not many people around.....but we are from SA so not use to walking around in the dark at night.... Was a little dissapointed as when I booked I specifically asked for a room on a high floor, at check-in they told me the room was on the 2nd floor. When told them that I had asked for one on a high floor they said they didn't have any....? So Staff not very helpful or friendly. Room was nice and spacious, kitchenette great even had a table you could sit and eat at!! Bathroom had a lovely big shower. Nightclub nextdoor a bit noisy, but we could live with it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and super convenient!”
Reviews.Author: Babybhen
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights stay and we loved it so much! The room is spacious, very spacious! The toilet is very clean. We had a nice view from our room. Overall its totally perfect! I would definitely come back and check out other Best Western hotels too!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable,Quiet, and Modern”
Reviews.Author: tpDesignImpact
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights upon arriving in Australia. Our room was on the second floor( in Australia they call it the 1st floor!) on the corner of the building and were very surprised at how quiet the room was given it's location in the heart of the city(Double windows). The location was fantastic, close to the subway station, restaurants, bars(some open 24 hrs!). A little convenience store was 2 doors down and was handy for snacks, drinks, fruit, etc. The room was clean, cool, spacious, the bathroom huge and modern. Very nice! The only thing I thought was odd is that the coffee/espresso cafe in the lobby was closed on the weekend! WTF? Internet Service was ridiculously priced so that I refused to pay AUD$5/ hr and just used my cellular service. Make it reasonable and I'll pay, gouge me and I'll reject it outright. Housekeeping didn't get to our room until 4pm when we had been out all day since 9am and were resting, that's when they wanted to clean our room!. The next day when we were going out we stopped by the front desk and asked to have it cleaned while we were out and it was done! Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for location near Hyde Park and spacious room with kitchenette.”
Reviews.Author: Dee1103
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice surprise. The neighborhood is a little run-down at first glance, but very convenient. Lots of small restaurants a block away, a couple of markets, and Hyde Park an easy 2 blocks walk. We walked from the train station with our 2 roller bags because it was close but it is also uphill! Friendly check-in, breakfast available but not included in our rate ($190), only one elevator but the hotel is small so not a problem for us. The windows in the room open (we were on the last floor, the 6th) and there is a/c. The kitchenette was a nice surprise and we used some of the equipment but were only there for a night before flying out so no meals were cooked. We paid $5 for internet access in our room. The hotel was quiet for sleeping and the bed was comfortable but we had trouble getting the room temperature to our liking.. All had been remodeled recently so the bathroom was quite sleek. The sofa in the room was probably a sleeper thought I did not look.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding bargain in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Dsbrown93446
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for the first three days of a two week trip to Australia in January. Hotel perfectly served out needs. Rooms are large and recently renovated with excellent bed, double panes windows which kept the city noise to an absolute minimum and were stylish without being over the top. Don't be put off by the lobby which is essentially an entry way and not very well appointed. As we were out and about early and late the fact that there is no restaurant in the hotel was not a problem. Very conveniently located to Darlo and Surry Hills restaurants and also convenient to the train stations at Museum and Central. We arrived in Sydney at a 15 hour flight from LA at 6am and so had booked the room for the night before. We have had bad experiences before where rooms had been given away as we had not checked in the night before...not here, where not only was the room ready but checkin was swift so we got right up to the room and a couple hours of sleep. One word of advice-let the front desk know when you leave in the morning and ask that housekeeping clean the room early, so they do not show up late afternoon after you have just returned from a day of activities.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, modern hotel excellent for anyone wanting to explore sydney”
Reviews.Author: KylieKarratha
Reviews.Content: Spent new years in this hotel 2010/11 - it was one of the cheapest in it's star range. There are none of the "extra" facilities like a gym, restaurant or shop, but it's so close to sydney CBD you don't really feel you miss that. My only complaint was that it was a bit noisy - we were on the road side which I think didn't help, and other guests sometimes let their doors slam which we heard. The kitchenette also helps if you want to keep some snacks or breaky. The hotel was very clean and modern - and I'm a bit of a germ-a-phobe who doesn't like to rough it, so that's saying something!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: att_81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel earlier this year. Found it a very well located hotel, very clean. Our room was facing the road and unfortuantely there was traffic noise despite the double glazed windows. Only real low point was the lift which was extremely slow, which became annoying after a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Megamarisa
Reviews.Content: I did not expect the hotel to be this excellent at first. The room was big. I stayed with my parents in the same room. We felt confortable. The room was equipted with pantry and dinning table/chairs. Staffs were friendly and offered many helps to us. Tanya, the lady at the reception was very nice and helpful. The guy ( I forgot to ask his name) at the breakfast restuarant was also very sweet. The location was very convenient. Hyde park was right there. You can walk while enjoying the town to Opera House. It toke around good nice 25 minute walk. Saint Mary church was on the way to Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Small, Clean with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: mymktp1
Reviews.Content: A nice small hotel, clean rooms, and great location! The best part about this hotel was that it was very close to everything in walking distance! The subway was very near! However, do make sure that you tick the continental breakfast option when reserving...We could have sworn that we selected that option but I guess it didn't go through the system. Another strange thing was that we stayed here for two days and used some of the dishes that were in our room... however the maid never cleaned them? normally doesn't hotel service help with that each day? However we did enjoy our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great place”
Reviews.Author: johnedward54
Reviews.Content: Stayed the first week of December and received great service from the minute we walked in the door. An equipment malfunction resulted in a room upgrade. Despite being a light sleeper I found there were no noise issues. The room(s) standards were above those I thought advertised with everything well kept and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Lucyna32
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay - very friendly staff, comfortable and clean, great for a family with children. The only problem is parking.

Reviews.Title: “Third Stay..... Need I say more”
Reviews.Author: TMS1967
Reviews.Content: Third time staying in this Hotel. Friendly and helpful staff even when you are jet lagged On Hyde Park, good location. Great cappuccinos, in coffee bar. Nice Rooms. Stayed in Stellar house, little expensive but VERY roomy for 3 adults and 3 kids. Simple Furniture, but comfortable. Small Grocery store around the corner, had fridge in room. Munchies for early morning hunger. Use bus 380 or 333 to get to BONDI BEACH Always enjoy are stay here. Our home in sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at great price”
Reviews.Author: shannon2606
Reviews.Content: I needed to find a hotel for three nights for four adults and one child, and after a LOT of internet searching I found Hotel Stellar and was not disappointed. The staff were friendly and as we arrived before check-in time, we could secure our luggage in a storage room free of charge. We were able to get two adjoining double rooms (with lockable door in between) and a fold-out bed for my daughter. The rooms were very clean, modern, well serviced each day and fairly quiet (even though there was a busy road nearby). Our room was small but the room next door was big, so I guess it's just luck what you get! We didn't care because we were going to be sight-seeing most of the time. There's a good kitchenette so we could make breakfast in our room before heading out. I had to request an extra towel for my daughter and the staff were very prompt. The carpark is probably the biggest downside as it is located a short walk away from the hotel and is very tiny - only suitable for small cars (although my father managed to get his Mazda Tribute in and out of there!) plus I think they charged $20 per day. I booked through wotif and got a great price. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Family in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Axe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was within walking distance of the CBD, the ferry terminals, Hyde Park and Australian Museum. It was also easy to catch the bus to Bondi Beach, and Oxford Street (Paddington Market). The location is quiet and safe. Reception was very friendly and accommodating -- they allowed us to check in at 7:00am! They got a room ready for us, so we could crash after our 24 hrs in transit. The room was a family room with 2 large beds. It had a convenient kitchenette, TV and DVD player. It wasn't the most attractive room, being quite bland, and dated -- but was clean, good air con, and the bathroom was clean and modern. And considering the great price, an excellent place. Internet is not included, $5/hr in the internet cafe on the main floor.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: JeannieM10
Reviews.Content: We were going to a concert in the CBD, so rather than try to park near the venue or get a cab all the way home, we stayed at the Hotel Stellar. Our room (102) overlooked Wentworth Avenue but with the double glazed window, the traffic noise was not obvious; earplugs were provided, but we didn't need them. The room itself was spacious and comfortable -had we been staying longer we would have appreciated the kitchenette to enable us to prepare some meals. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was well equipped, except for my little bugbear -no facewashers. The service at check in was excellent and when we needed a cab to go to the concert venue, the young assistant on the front desk stood in the rain to hail our cab for us.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: loveholidays20
Reviews.Content: We visited Sydey for a wedding and stayed the weekend at this hotel. It was great value and really good location. The rooms were spacious, very comfortable beds, clean and on the plus we had a kitchenette. The staff were really friendly and helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrishGuinness
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in June. when we arrived the Elevator was broken,I had to carry my suitcase to level 2,thank God I was not staying on level 5.... The hotel was very noisy, they even provided ear plugs to help with the noise. The area was a little seedy. Staff where friendly

Reviews.Title: “Very Unfair Changes & Cancellation Policy”
Reviews.Author: JLMac55
Reviews.Content: I was booked in to stay at this hotel on a Friday night, but had to stay in Melbourne until the Saturday and asked to change my booking to Sunday night instead. Although I tried to make the change 12 days prior to the bookiing, their cancellation policy states that CHANGES MUST BE MADE 14 DAYS PRIOR. There was no come back or negotiation, they just refused to change or cancel the booking so I lost my money. I will certainly never book here again and I would advise everYone about to make a booking to make absolutely sure they can make it on their assigned night. Very glad I hadn't booked for a week!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TCavs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in February. We weren't looking to break the bank and found the Hotel Stellar to be just right. Our room was clean and spacious, with a kitchenette allowing us to have breakfast and/lunch. The hotel is near a busy junction but noise is not a factor and shops/bars etc are within easy walking distance. Hyde Park is effectively just across the street and we enjoyed a couple of walks through there and on down to the botanical gardens and the harbour. Couldn't really fault this place.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, clean and comfortable, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Susannah_m
Reviews.Content: My accommodation for this work trip was booked through Wotif. I selected the Hotel Stellar because it included basic self-catering facilities, which usually means just a bit more space than a regular hotel room, and because it was only a short walk to and from my meeting venue. I enjoyed my short walk through Hyde Park after my meeting, and booked in. The facilities were what I expected (kitchen sink, microwave oven, etc.). The light above the desk was not quite up to the standard I would have liked for the extra reading i had to to, but the bedside light was ok. There were several nearby take-aways and cafes, and also a small supermarket, where I bought a few bits and pieces for dinner and breakfast. Easy to do, and in the circumstances, easier than dining out. The room was well equipped, and the bathroom a good size. The bed was comfortable, the air-conditioning unobtrusive, and being on the 6th floor, traffic noise at a minimum. I used the ironing board and iron, and was pleasantly surprised that the iron was of good quality, and clean. (this is not always the case). The Hotel Stellar also had a well stocked (and not unreasonably expensive) mini bar. I checked out in the morning, and again enjoyed the walk through Hyde Park for more meetings. Very unpretentious, and excellent value in Sydney. the staff were also courteous and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great location! Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: jasonbostoncl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights at Hotel Stellar and were pleasantly surprised with the hotel. The room was very clean and spacious. The location is great! The subway station (Museum) is just around the corner. This station is just 2 stops from Circular Quay (Sydney Opera House) and only a few stops from the Airport. It is about a 10-15 minutes walk to Darling Harbour, Royal Botanical Gardens or Queen Victoria Building and 25-30 minutes walk to the Opera House. It is a very nice central location to many of Sydney city's main attractions. Instead of a Harbour cruise, we spent $5 on a ferry ticket from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay and were treated to some beautiful views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House. There are many great places to eat and shop nearby the hotel. If you enjoy Asian food, there are a handful of restaurants on Liverpool Street with excellent food. The staff at the hotel was friendly and helpful. The room we had was clean and the bed was comfortable. We were on the 5th floor and didn't have any issues with noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: aplondon
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 6 nights before Christmas and Hotel Stellarwas a perfect location for exploring Sydney. Our room was one of the cheaper ones and a little dark, but was reasonably roomy with a kitchenette. The bathroom was modern, with an efficient shower. We liked the location - near to trendy Darlinghurst and walkable to Darling Harbour, the CBD and even Circular Quay - though it was quicker to get a train back. It was also on the Bondi bus route. The front desk were helpful. If you are not looking for 5 star facilities and happy to go out to eat, this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Newly Remodeled Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelinLeather
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Jan 2010 for 1 night while flying back through Sydney to catch a flight the next day. The hotel is very small so there aren't many rooms or "extras" but the room I had was very nice, VERY clean. A full kitchenette was in my room and they also had internet available ($20/per day) in each room. I paid $109/night and I booked it through the BestWestern.com website. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for visiting Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Paleandinteretsting
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel which has recently been renovated into rooms with kitchenettes (or as they call it apartment suites). It has been done very nicely and works really well if you're travelling with a baby (5 month old) in order to get takeaways in or doing basic preparations for meals and baby bottles. The bathrooms are really nice with a massage shower but no bath which was fine for us. The only poor thing I have to say about room is that the door has a massive gap under and you can hear everyone coming and going (we were top floor with about 5 rooms on each floor so not too bad) so we put a blanket to muffle it but didn't really keep us awake much. We had continental breakfast in with our room price which was very good and great healthy options of cereal, yoghurts, fruit, toasties along with the croissants, danishes and yummy banana bread. The location next the Hyde Park is very good for exploring the city and lot more lively than CBD and less touristy than Darling Harbour. It is next to Oxford Street which on weekends is very lively and great for going out for a few drinks if you don't have a baby! It is a popular area for the gay community and the rainbow flags are everywhere but that just adds to making the area quite cool.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Fantastic staff and Management”
Reviews.Author: DaveyIRL
Reviews.Content: Ok it took me one year to write this but I promised I would. I checked in late on arrival and the staff were really great. The hotel is near everything you would need including the interesting night life :). A small minor point was that the life was having a few noise problems when i was there - without hesitation the Manager upgraded me to a nice big room facing the park - this was really nice and very restful even in a big city and I was very appreciate of the hotel's kindness. The Manager is a great guy and really friendly (good taste in films to - he recommened the film 'dark side of the heart'. He also helped me plan trips to Hunter Valley and even recommended a few nice red wines to buy. I am sorry i did not put up a review sooner. Put it this way if I am in Syndey again I will definately stay here. Feel free to contact me about thiss or any other reviews I have posted here -

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money”
Reviews.Author: NL_tulp
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting too much from this hotel but turned out to be pretty good. For the money paid we got a big room with two big beds,very comfortable. The room was spacious and good equiped,with the small kitchenette that was great. As said before,the location is very good and the staff very helpful and kind. The only thing I could say was not that good was the housekeeping. They clean only each three days and for the rest the do only the trash out and the beds. This could be improved. But for the rest,comfy beds,good price and location.Would reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “best value for money”
Reviews.Author: Martina049
Reviews.Content: This hotel presents great value for money. I was lucky enough to be upgraded to a Deluxe Room. The room was very spacious with soundproof windows. All 5 star mod cons were available incl. minibar and coffee shop next to lobby. Staff very friendly and helpfull, location close to train, bus, convenience shops,restaurants and Hyde Park.

Reviews.Title: “Practical”
Reviews.Author: bmiflyer23
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 4 nights here in Room 205 (smoking floor). I work in a hotel in the UK which used to be part of the Best Western consortium. Firstly, my room was a good size with two king size beds. Room 205 is opposite the lift but I didn't notice any noise which affected me. TV is flat screen but not LCD and very basic. Some channels were non-functioning. Walk-in shower leaked and the shower pressure wasn't high enough. The bed was average, not particularly comfy. There is no duvet - only blankets and sheets. Windows do not open inside the bedroom, only the bathroom window does. Housekeeping could be better when it comes to servicing (attention to detail) but provided a good job on the third night full housekeeping service.

Reviews.Title: “A right find”
Reviews.Author: Naranje
Reviews.Content: Usually, the words Best Western associated with any hotel would make me run a mile. However, this one breaks the mould. The hotel is well situated on top of the 'museum' train stop, only 2 stops from circular quay and most of the tourist attractions, Darling Harbour is about 10 minutes walk and Hyde Park is across the street. The rates seem amazing comparing to the others in the vicinity and the hotel is not shabby, The rooms were spacious, clean and had everything you could need, including a small kitchenette. So far, so good. There is a small residents lounge/bar which I didn't really investigate, there is also a coffee shop for breakfast goodies. I even had a small accident in the room and the staff were very good and reasonable about it. The things to watch for are: (1) sounds do carry, the elevator didn't worry us, but you could hear other things. (2) some wag kept sliding the don not disturb sign on our door, so our room wasn't made up every day... All in all, I guess you can do a lot, lot worse than this place!

Reviews.Title: “Loved having the mini kitchen area”
Reviews.Author: Kauai2007
Reviews.Content: We booked this room during the low season and were also able to use a coupon to make it come out to be roughly $80 USD per night for a room with a queen bed. From the outside, the building doesn't look that special or particularly nice. But inside, the rooms were modern looking and nicely maintained. Our room came with a small kitchen area - had a sink, some dishes/glasses, a toaster, a mini fridge (had a minibar inside that you could eat from, for a cost), and a small table with 2 chairs. Tha bathroom was clean but there was hardly any counter space. It had a shower in it (no bathtub, which was fine with us). The room was quite cold and there is an A/C unit above the door to the bathroom and that also acts as a heater (use the remote, this was not clear to us after reading the manuel - we had to ask the people downstairs). Overall, it was a good stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_Blueberry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Stellar for two nights in July. Although it is not much to look at from the outside, we were pleasantly surprised by both the hotel rooms and the service. When we checked in, the front desk staff were friendly and polite. We didn't find the elevators loud at all. Our rooms were very nicely decorated and clean. Our favourite part of the room was the heater found in the washroom. As someone who gets very cold after taking a shower, I thought the heater was a nice touch and showed thought. After we had checked out, our shuttle bus to the airport didn't show up. When I approached the front desk about the situation, they offered to call the shuttle service and when we decided to just take a cab to the airport, the front desk clerk was actually sweet enough to hail the cab for us. The location is within walking distance to the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and Hyde Park. I would absolutely recommend Hotel Stellar to anybody visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, no frills central hotel”
Reviews.Author: nutkins47
Reviews.Content: The exterior and entrance to the hotel are not elegant and the lift is pretty third rate. however the rooms are well furnished, large and the staff very helpful. The location is superb for local facilities such as pharmacy, supermarket, restaurants & bars. A bus to downtown leaves from just around the corner. it was just a ten minute walk to a major cinema complex and the same distance tfor the railway into the Blue mountains

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but room service disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mbug43
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and clean and the staff were pleasant enough. Be careful when you order room service, because, although they advertise that room service is available until 4:00 am, it may not be. We tried to order room service after spending a day out at the cricket. We decided not to eat much at the cricket because we saw that the hotel offered an extensive room service menu till 4:00 am, and we thought it might be nice and romantic after spending the day out. Although it was late (about midnight), we rang for room service and were assured that it was no problem and that it would take 20 minutes to be ready. About 5 minutes after placing the order, reception rang back to inform us that there was nothing left except mash potatoes. He then gave us the number for pizza hut and assured us that they would deliver to our door. He didn't mention that they were in fact closed. So we had a packet of cashews and a packet of pringles for dinner that night. Very very disappointing. Why advertise room service when you can't guarentee it?? Also their parking facilities were a bit dodgy, stay away from it unless you are a world champion at reverse parking ... you could JUST fit a mazda 121 in the parking spot.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you have a good rate...”
Reviews.Author: ibreak4coffee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights last August during a trip to Sydney. Let me up front give the positives: - Location next to Hyde Park is fantastic, and its a short walk down to the train station to get to the airport. Much more economical than a cab. The amazing Longrain Thai restaurant is just down the street as well. - The rooms are pretty spacious and the bed was comfortable. Noticed a mouse trap next to the fridge but didn't see any problems. I didn't encounter any of the noise problems others have complained about here. - There's a small coffee shop in the lobby. While it isn't open a lot of the time, the coffee is good and its nice to be able to get one right there (though the Starbucks across Hyde Park offers a good view of the park). Now the negatives. - Front Desk: I should have known something would go wrong when my wife and I arrived at 7am fresh from a 22 hour trek from New York to Sydney, and we were made to wait for a good 15 minutes while the girl behind the front desk argued with the guy checking out. Obviously she has to attend to that customer, but we weren't even acknowledged. After he left, we were told it would be 1 hour before we could check-in since housekeeping was cleaning the room right then. We walked across Hyde Park to Starbucks and waited. When we came back, the girl said the room was ready but that she had to go upstairs to check first before we could check in. we went to sit in the lounge... and waited and waited. I came back 30 minutes later, and it emerged she had forgotten about us even though she had nothing to do. My wife had to flag another staff member, who went upstairs and we were finally allowed to check in. On departure, we had no problems, but opted to store our luggage in the small closet in the lobby. When we returned to the hotel, they simply gave us the key and told us to fetch the luggage ourselves. That's fine - we werent staying in the Four Seasons - but at the same time I'm not sure I'd leave my luggage there again if they simply give the key to anyone and they can take what they want. - Internet: Off the lobby there are several computers for internet surfing. I forget the rates, but they were reasonable. The computers on the other hand are about as old as the country of Australia itself. It would take literally 5 minutes for any webpage to load. We bought 30 minutes of internet time in order to book some hotels for our trip to New Zealand, and we hardly were able to visit more than two sites. - Elevator: Its as bad as advertised. I would certainly recommend considering staying here if you're getting a good rate, as the location isnt bad. On the other hand, be aware there are probably better deals to be had in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Location: great, hotel: so so”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_NL
Reviews.Content: First the positive things: the location near Hyde Park is great. You can take the train from the airport straight to Museum Station and walk for about 5 minutes to the hotel. Breakfast was good, altough the "Green Lounge" is outdated. I think that the big problem with this hotel is the uncompleted renovation. For example: they placed new windows in the rooms, but kept the old curtain rails. Because of this the curtains hit the windows and the curtain rails were loose. This looks shabby. There is also a very old elevator in the hotel that makes a lot of noise that you can hear in your room. The room was big enough and clean. Our first impression was not very good. An employee had promised us a room via e-mail on the highest floor. This was impossible according to the reception. Luckily I saved a printout of the mail so I was able to prove it. But anyhow, the room was gone so we had to stay on a lower floor. When we entered the room the auto-closing system was broken so the door was stuck halfway. The door of the bathroom was also very stuck. I reported this to the reception and they promised to tell the maintenance man. Next day I met the maintenance man in the corridor and asked him about it. He said they didn't report it and the maintenance book was empty. But he would fix it right away and he did like promised. On the last day we had to go to the airport very early. The girl from the breakfast "lounge" made a wonderful breakfast basket. So thumbs up for some of the staff and thumbs down for reception. Recommendable: * Sydney Bike Tours, * Sushi-E inside Establishment Hotel on the 4th floor, George Street. * Sydney Art Museum (free entry) * The mono-rail is also handy and a station is near Museum station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowAnnemarie
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Stellar. The hotel is very clean and well furnished. The rooms were large and comfortable and included a small kitchen with microwave, kettle toaster etc great after a day touring the City. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel is very centrally located. We couldn't have asked for a better stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of elevator noise in some rooms ... and thin walls”
Reviews.Author: VioMd
Reviews.Content: We've actually stayed in this hotel twice this year, it has a great location, is very clean, and all round could be such a great place...if it wasn't for that elevator! This time we spent a sleepless first night on the 6th floor, and the noise from the elevator was unbelievable. Due to the hotel's location, guests obviously come and go a lot, and late at night, which shouldn't be a problem - but if the elevator makes this whooshing sound every time it moves, believe me, it can drive you insane. The next morning, the staff was very helpful to give us another room on the third floor (where we still heard the elevator) but it was better. I noticed another reviewer mentioned the lift noise before me, and the hotel management replied that the problem of "intermittent noise" from the elevator would be fixed by September '08. As of end of November, this obviously was not the case. Generally, the walls in this hotel are thin, and you will hear your neighbors' conversations and every time the (heavy) bathroom doors slam shut. Due to the noise problems we will not stay in this hotel again - a shame, really, because otherwise it has all the ingredients to be a nice little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This was a exceptional hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HelsbelsPerth
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Stellar. The hotel is very clean and well furnished. The rooms were large and comfortable and we were upgraded on arrival. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel is very centrally located. We couldn't have aksed for a better stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: YorkFoodie
Reviews.Content: We decided on Hotel Stellar as the place to stay while celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and were very pleased. Arriving at about 7.30am off the night flight from Perth, the receptionist directed us to a small bathroom where we could freshen up before storing our bags prior to check-in. Check-in went smoothly, we had booked through an online site and there were no hassles. The room was large and very well maintained. There was a small kitchenette with refrigerator, microwave, tea and coffee making facilities (with bonus coffee plunger and real coffee), plates, cutlery etc. The bathroom was spotless. No views, but we weren't there for the views. In the lobby area was a number of internet PCs available for a small daily fee, as well as a sitting area with couches, TV, books and magazines etc. The staff were fantastic and quick to assist with any request. On our anniversary night it was pouring with rain and the taxi we had called for to take us to the theatre had not arrived. Without hestitaiton the receptionist grabbed an umbrella and went out into the rain to the main cross road and brought back a taxi. Unknown to us, our daughter had contacted the hotel and asked for champagne and Swiss chocolates to be delivered to our room on our anniversary, which they arranged for a delightful surprise. We found the hotel was a reasonable walk from many of the places we wanted to visit in the central part of Sydney, and close to the train for everywhere else. In fact, we arrived and left on the train from the nearby Museum station. We didn't have any qualms walking around at night, admittedly this was mid-week so perhaps the clubbers were at home. Again perhaps due to being mid-week, the night club in the hotel posed no problems for us. One of us is a VERY light sleeper, and had no issues with noise. The only thing that did disappoint was the paucity of room service meals. Due to the rain we decided to stay in for dinner one evening and could not get a meal delivered so we tried room service. Unfortunately they did not have an in-house kitchen so our choices were a lavash wrap sandwich or a microwaved lasagne. The evening receptionist was very apologetic and said this situation was being reviewed so it may have changed by now. We felt the Stellar was indeed stellar and would have no hesitation in staying there should we visit Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: marshymellow
Reviews.Content: Fantastic rooms, great location, very helpful staff and overall a great deal for rooms in the Sydney CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: oldpuggler
Reviews.Content: We booked a two night stay over the weekend at Hotel Stellar. We stayed on the 5th floor overlooking the Liverpool and Wentworth St junctions, thank god for the double glazed windows that kept the majority of the traffic noise out, however we found most of the noise came from inside the hotel, with a noisy elevator and paper thin walls making it pretty hard to get a good nights sleep. The room we stayed in was great, it was big, nicely renovated and clean. Pros: Great location, very close to "Spice I Am" (Great little thai place down the bottom of Wentworth st), trains and Oxford st shopping/partying strip. Clean rooms with great facilities (foxtel, microwave, kettle, toaster etc) Cons: noise from elevator and other guests

Reviews.Title: “All good”
Reviews.Author: Embradon
Reviews.Content: Friendly, clean, well serviced, good sized rooms. Good facilities in room. Our room was quiet despite overlooking the city centre junction. Wireless internet in room ( though it was rather expensive for mediocre speed). Convenient for "Museum" station on the central loop. (beware this station has no elevator or escalator - so if you have heavy bags access is a chore). Within pleasant strolling distance or two train stops from Circular Quay ferries, and Opera House, closer to Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Annata
Reviews.Content: We rented a standard room with an additional rollaway bed for three people altogether. pros: - clean, spacious rooms - great toilets - comfortable beds - good price! - 7 minute walk from Museum station cons: - hotel did not look very "4-star" from the outside - no swimming pool or gym - 7 minute walk from Museum station (i mean, there were hotels that were closer to the train station for those of us that are very lazy!) general comments: an affordable, well maintained building in a central location. would recommend it to anyone else looking for simple luxury at an affordable price!

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Again For Sure!”
Reviews.Author: babmadsa
Reviews.Content: Arrived home yesterday after a few days at Hotel Stellar. The Hotel is a must for its location, value for money and character. We were suprised at how large the room was and it was great being fully equipped with a large ensuite, great kitchen facilities and ample room to move around and relax. We were located on the first floor and i was worried we would get a heap of traffic noise, but we didnt as our room was at the back of the hotel. The other thing i like was the fact we could open our windows for air. Staff were friendly and we took use of the car park they offer for $16.50 a night, undercover and secure. I dont want to complain as i really enjoyed my stay, but it did frustrate me that the room had tried to be opened at 8.30, 3 times by cleaners as my fellow traveller had checked out earlier that morning and paid, and told staff that there was stil someone in the room till checkout time to not disturb. I even had the Do Not Disturb sign on the door. Staff were apologetic, but lucky i had the latch on the door otherwise they would of just enetered with me inside by myself. I will stay again and you must try it!

Reviews.Title: “Good stuff”
Reviews.Author: aussieinSF
Reviews.Content: This hotel surpassed my expectations. Perhaps it was the fact that they upgraded us for free, but the room we got was the largest hotel room I've ever been in. Also, we'd requested to be put on a high floor, so they put us on the top floor, with a view of the park. Sweet! The bed was king-sized and comfy, there was a kitchen and mini-bar, and the bathroom was huge. Nice complimentary toiletries in the bathroom, although unfortunately there was no free moisturiser. Can't have everything, I guess, especially when it's so reasonably priced. Also nice was the hotel happy hour. They have two for one drinks every day from 5-7pm. The location of the hotel was really convenient, so we could have a couple of drinks, and then head out to dinner somewhere. I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: STRACJ
Reviews.Content: Nicely done boutique hotel in easy walking distance from main central attractions. Direct route through Hyde Park and or Botanical Gardens all the way to Circular Quay (20-30 min walk). Cafe on ground floor next door serves good breakfasts etc, did not take up the inclusive breakfast option with room as do not eat enough to justify cost. Room was very clean and well decorated with kitchenette and mini bar, tv and nice en suite with walk in shower. We were at the back of the hotel so definately no street noise, rooms are double glazed in any case so not likely to be a problem anywhere. Only very minor issue was slight lift (elevator) noise (swoosh), this was not excessive and became infrequent in the evening, this in no way spoilt our stay, other rooms across landing may not suffer. Happy hour around 6pm, 2 for 1 beers, good internet access, washing machines and lugage store available. Staff helpful and security seemed good (card access control on lobby after 7pm). Bottle shop (booze) and minimarket around the corner in Oxford Street.

Reviews.Title: “noisy lift”
Reviews.Author: helenWellingtonNz
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Stellar after reading good reviews. When we arrived we had been put right next to the lift which makes a terrible noise and can be heard through the walls. i had requested a quiet room in my email when booking. It would be obvious to anyone that this was not a quiet room. As they were fully booked we had to find another Hotel to stay at. We booked weeks in advance and so were disappointed that they had not taken into account my request for a quiet room. on the plus side the staff were helpful and polite when we cancelled our stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: margheritaBologna
Reviews.Content: Clean, big, with all the confort. There was the kitchen in the bedroom. They have a laudry with coin ( confortable when you have to wash clothes spending few money), and at the reception they were very nice. Our room was busy thus they gave us a bigger room for the same prize. It is in the centre but at the night time it is quite. They have a garage ( unfortunable few place). It is close to Oxford street ( full of pub, restaurant but also a lot of gay, trans, but it isn't dangerous). The person at the reception are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Character”
Reviews.Author: sailsherm
Reviews.Content: A great location to visit Sydney from... A somewhat reno'd hotel that had all the comforts of home; a small kitchen, a great shower and three twin beds. We stayed in a triple on the top (6th) floor; near the elevator. This way the only complaint we could make during our stay. The noise from the elevator was enough to wake us in the morning; we didn't go to bed early enough for it to be a problem in the evening. Even with our room facing the street, there was very little street noise. The lift seemed to be really the only issue. I think that being at the top floor may have been the reason. (??) The staff were great. They looked after our bags when we arrived early before check-in, they helped contact tour companies and taxis. and they locked up our bags when we had a late flight out. They were great bartenders at happy hour. Just all-round; more than eager to please. The internet was very reasonably priced and lots of terminals. There is a coffee shop next door so during the week, the customers of the coffee shop use the internet as well. Still seems to be enough for all. Coffee Shop is closed on Sunday!! We enjoyed the fact that it was a little bit older and seemed to have a bit of character to it. Its a small, personable place where the staff make you feel appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Coopers4
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here at the end of March in a twin room on the 6th [top] floor. The beds were comfortable, the room a very good size, although a tad gloomy, and the bathroom large and modern. Unfortunately the hotel is an older building and our room was next to the lift well which was very noisy until late at night and again early each morning. We were also bothered by noise from the room next door, caused by a woman endlessly walking in hard heeled shoes on a tiled floor. On the good side there was very little street noise as our room faced the back of the building. The front desk staff were always courteous and helpful and were happy to store our luggage for the day when we checked out. Wireless internet access is reasonably priced and there are computers available for use in an area off the lobby. The location is good if you don't mind walking; the city centre, Oxford Street, King's Cross, Woollomooloo, and Surry Hills are easily accessible. One of my favourite Sydney restaurants, Longrain, is a very short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: familyof4Melbourne
Reviews.Content: Recently organised 3 nights accomodation in 2 rooms for my parents & my aunt & uncle at Stellar Hotel in Sydney after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. Booked through Wotif as unable to get 2 rooms direct through the hotel as they were fully booked. My parents were after accomodation within their budget & were very impressed with the quality of accomodation & hotel location for the price they paid.(Worked out at approx $150 per night per room,great for Sydney unless you want to stay in a dive!) They had no complaints what so ever with their rooms which were very clean & spacious. Close to the city centre & all the tourist spots as well as transport. Plenty of places to eat close by. Would definately book there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: orph
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 3 bedroom 'penthouse' apartment and were very impressed with the size of it. Huge living area and master bedroom, much bigger than any other apartment I'd stayed in, especially for the price. 2nd and 3rd bedrooms were average size but still generous.
