Large kitchen with lots of bench space if you like to cook. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and were more than willing to help us find restaurants and hire taxis. You can walk to the CBD, Darling Harbour, Circular Quay and Central Train station from the hotel, and it is around the corner from the Oxford St shopping/clubbing district. One thing to note is that the 3 bedroom apartment is slightly separate from the rest of the hotel, tacked on the side in a separate building, so you need to go down some stairs to get to it. Also, this apartment seems to have missed out on the renovation, as it the decor was a little dated and not up to the standard of the other guest rooms. For the price though, I still think it is a great value hotel and a good place to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely sensational”
Reviews.Author: gurlrca
Reviews.Content: We secured a bargain deal through CentralR.com to stay 3 nights at Hotel Stellar. I can't fault the hotel at all. Great location within easy walking distance of all attractions yet hotel was quiet and undisturbing at night. Bed was oh so comfortable, mini bar selection was great, internet access was cheap and fast. Our room was much larger than we were expecting and we asked if we could upgrade to a king sized bed which was no problem and no additional charge. On our return to the hotel each day it was always spotless and beautifully serviced. Staff were UNBELIEVEABLY helpful and friendly and we felt very welcome and taken care of throughout our stay. I wouldn't hesitate to stay again any time I'm in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this small hotel”
Reviews.Author: smrlb66
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Australia in November 2007 from Canada and stayed 4 nights at the Best Western Hotel Stellar in Sydney prior to taking the 28-day "Around Australia" cruise. We had read the reviews on Trip Advisor and can only add that they were accurate. The Stellar is a very well appointed small boutique hotel. Centrally located - we could walk downtown Sydney in 20 minutes. Near bus stops, walking distance to railway station (train to airport) and restaurants. The rooms are spacious with kitchenette which we didn't need, but it would be a good feature for someone staying longer. The bathroom were all marble and tiles and quite large. The room and bathroom were very clean and new looking. The staff was very helpful and courteous. There is a locker room off the Lobby for storing luggage, if needed and reasonably priced internet access in the Lobby. A small cafeteria adjacent to the Lobby (not own by the hotel) was excellent for a light breakfast. Lovely, very reasonably priced, small hotel that we would recommend highly. A winner in a city that is rather expensive otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK.”
Reviews.Author: GermantownMD
Reviews.Content: Very average hotel. The room was a good size, but a bit dark. The kitchen area was spacious, but not well furnished. The lobby area and hallways were a bit seedy. The best part of the hotel was a fairly good location and the cafe attached to the lobby. Great coffee and good breakfast. It was oK for the money, but I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eveski97
Reviews.Content: Didnt really have any expectations for this city hotel but it was great! Excellent location - dont do what we did and take a taxi from the central station to the hotel - your quicker walking it (get the map out!) due to one way streets and all that jazz! Right at the bottom of hyde park so instant and easy access to the city centre! Room was a fair size - nice and comfortable - cooking facilities consisted of a hob, kettle, microwave and toaster so made sure we were fed and watered coz to be honest we found it pretty hard to get anything decent to eat in the city as one of us is vegetarian (could not find the hard rock cafe for luv nor money!).... bathroom was very clean and nice - even had a wee heater which was good coz it was pretty cold when we were there! We were on the top floor...no views as such unless you look sideways up to hyde park but to be honest - who cares! Reception were nice and friendly - one gentleman in particular (he was either scandanavian or european) seemed to be there all the time (think he had a bed in the back! But he tried so hard to help with any queries! Cheers! So yes - recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & price”
Reviews.Author: runfrodo
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms and convenient location. Close to shopping and city centre attractions. Good restaurants nearby (down stanley st.) and friendly staff. Stayed there for 5 days. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: grater1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 times now and this time appreciated the newly renovated rooms. The rooms are all now double glazed which makes for a very peacful sleep in the middle of Sydney. Each time we have found the staff to be friendly and rooms always clean. Nice large king beds and showers with good pressure The location is great - a 10 min walk to the heart of Pitt STreet Mall or the the entertainment district, china town, art gallery, and the clubs and cafes of Oxford Street .

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Teecha
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Stellar recently. We arrived early and were pleased to be able to check into our room straight away. The female receptionist was very nice and very accommodating. The room was facing Wentworth Ave, but had double windows, so we didnt hear as much traffic noise as we thought we would. The room itself was nicely done out in modern colours and spacious and clean. (The bed was super comfortable too) . The bathroom was fantastic and large and the water pressure was great. (Could have done with more than one bar of soap though). It was nice to have the kitchen facilities to make a cup of tea or whatever. The hotel itself was within walking distance of the city (about 10-15 minutes). We also walked to the Paddington Market one morning and that took about half an hour. We ate most nights on Oxford Street as there are heaps of cheap eateries along there. The only complaint I would have about our room (and it is minor) would be the poor television reception, but we werent there to watch t.v! We had breakfast once in the Green Light lounge and at $9 a head it was reasonably cheap and you could eat all you wanted. All in all, I would recommend Stellar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KeithnVic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at the Hotel Stellar in Sydney. The location was in between the airport and the main attractions of Sydney. The harbor/opera house were within walking distance for those who are able to walk. I would say the walk is about 6 miles to the main attractions of Sydney. The hotel was clean, nice and the staff was friendly. We experienced rain while we were there and the hotel offered us free umbrellas for our use. There was no restaurant at the hotel but there was a cafe attached to the hotel and the food was good. I would recommend the hotel and would stay at the hotel again. Vic

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hitchiker_bear
Reviews.Content: Spent three pleasant nights at the Stellar. Ours was a pleasant, very clean, (newly furnished in todays trendy beige/stone colours) studio room which faced east , and between the high rise apartments, managed to get the morning sun, so was not dark or gloomy with ample windows. Windows were double glazed but could be left ajar, if air conditioning was not preferred. Not too noisy given a large city situation, we are from a country town, and really only the occasional emergency vehicle sirens disturbed us with the windows ajar. The Stellars location was perfect. From the domestic airport to the Museum Station, (15 to 20 minutes) then a short ,slightly uphill walk and you are there. We visited Sydney to watch the QM2 and QE2's grand entrance into Sydney Harbour, so it was a pleasant walk from the hotel to Mrs Macquaries Chair, the Gardens, China Town or city shopping. The general concierge gentleman and ladies who attended the reception desk were relaxed, and professional< and their smiles came easily and naturally whenever we passed through reception>

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably insulting concierge!!!”
Reviews.Author: Anthonyson
Reviews.Content: Hotel was conveniently located, We stayed for 8 days.Hall way constantly smelt of urine.Rooms were newly refurbished and hence,excellent.Showers were however far too weak. The whole stay was ruined by a remarkable incident on the last day when we had returned to pick up our luggage ( we checked out a.m.). The receptionist Pavol,when I requested to have our luggage back,held up a miniture bottle of whiskey and asked me to explain it (it had been emptied and clear liquid put in its place). I understood the implication and told him that it was,nt us and that we had,nt used the mini bar at all during our stay. To my astonishment he repeated the accusation.At this point I took exception and again repeated that we didnt touch the mini bar and that his insistance was rude and offensive. At this point I thought he would back down but amazingly,in very sarcastic tones,he repeated the accusation!!! Well,at 45 years old ,and having travelled extensivley with business and pleasure, and also being in the customer service business I was astounded at the audacity of Pavol. I confess that I got very angry and shouted at him that ,having paid over $2800 to settle my bill would I really want to cheat them out of $5! Also,surely I would of done a better job and put "tea" colour liquid in the bottle? My taxi came and I left shaking with anger,we had spent three weeks in Sydney and ,up to that point ,had had an excellent experience. What a great shame. I have written twice to the hotel but I suspect that my letters are being intercepted as I have still not received a reply from hte General Manager. A reply has come back,and they say that Pavol has been a long standing and good employee.I leave you to draw your own conclusions. I think this hotel relies on its location for its business.I certainly dont think its due to its Customer Care! Thankyou.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Star”
Reviews.Author: DonMo
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room, welcoming staff, short walk to shopping. What more do you need.

Reviews.Title: “Well, it was just okay”
Reviews.Author: MaggieP6789
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice, and okay for the price. Got an okay deal through centralr (okay deal--not a great deal.) Rooms are nice with microwave, fridge, stove. But they are not particularly cleaned well everyday--not vacummed as far as I can tell. Soap, shampoo not repalced daily. (Actually we had one little pitiful bar of soap throughout our stay.) So housekeeping is not exactly assiduous. Also, they require a $50 key deposit, which I have not experience elsewhere. Front desk staff is overall not very good or helpful. Their was one girl who seemed pretty on the ball, so we waited until she was on duty to have a taxi booked, ask questions, etc. The website says they hae a concierge, but other than the one person manning the front desk, I saw no concierge. Location is about a 20 minute walk to the harbour/operahouse/Rocks. We stayed ther 5 nights, and the one helpful girl finally gave us a map of Sydney and told us where the nearest train staion was after we were there a couple of days. I went across the street to the Y Hotel to ask their staff for information, use the internet, etc. Would have stayed there instead had they not been booked. Still, the Hotel Stellar rooms are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, good design”
Reviews.Author: gayChicagotrvlr
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Stellar for a week in late July, visiting from Chicago. It has great value (we booked on the web and had a rate half the price of similar hotels in Sydney), features large spacious rooms with minimalist, modern design and lighting, is exceptionally clearn, and a good location. (You might do better location-wise as a tourist staying nearer Circular Quay, which is nevertheless an easy subway, bus, or 20-25-minute walk through beatiful Hyde Park. Location would be excellent for business travellers on a budget, and perfect for gay and lesbian Mardi Gras, right at the beginning of Oxford Street. Museum subway stop is 1.5 blocks away; Central a quick cab ride.) The hotel staff is competent and friendly. There's no concierge and they don't have a terrific amount of info on Sydney; the lobby is basically ambience-free, but it's tremendous value for the price anyway. Our room had a kitchenette, and there's a coin laundry. Looks like the hotel caters mostly to tourists -- all ages, lots of nationalities (Germans, Americans, Canadians, Brits, Australians, New Zealanders...), gay and straight, families, groups of friends. Two very minor surprises: little flexibility on check-out time (but they happily stow luggage) and the in-room safes are a small, added daily fee. Well above average, and highly recommended if you're not looking for high-end frills.

Reviews.Title: “Great All-rounder!”
Reviews.Author: Europeanhoneymoon
Reviews.Content: Reasonably quiet, close to everything especially transport, very friendly staff; especially the cleaners and the maintenance man (ask him for directions, he's awesome!). Facilities were good except the tv fuzzed from time to time but the staff compensated us for this nicely. We would recommend people stay here as it is well worth the price and the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD”
Reviews.Author: KANGA54
Reviews.Content: just spent 2 nights at the steller hotel,wentworth avenue ,sydney.very clean,smart rooms with all mod cons.would recommend .just be careful of the weather ,we were just sightseeing and managed to get sunburnt,so remember the sun tan cream even if you are just walking about.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Hotel Stellar
HotelInfo.Address: 4 Wentworth Avenue, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
